0: AMES, Iowa -- The driver of a stolen truck who was shot and killed on the Iowa State University campus Monday has been identified as 19-year-old Tyler Comstock of Boone. McPherson has been with the Ames Police Department for more than eight years and is assigned to the day shift patrol division. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Monday’s shooting was the first time McPherson has fired his weapon at a suspect on duty, said Ames police Cmdr. Geoff Huff. McPherson is on paid administrative leave pending an investigation into what occurred and whether he should be charged in the fatal shooting. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Huff said Ames police, the Iowa State University police and the Iowa Division of Criminal Investigation are working together on the case. McPherson unsuccessfully tried to ram the vehicle to get it to stop, police reported. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Comstock is accused of continuing to drive around the grassy area, prompting pedestrians to jump out of the way, according to Ames police.
